bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Fire and Life Insurance was chartered in 1848. In 1860 they had offices at 433 Chestnut Street.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of records and business correspondence of Francis Blackburn, secretary of the Philadelphia Fire and Life Insurance Company. Materials include: policy statements, letters accompanying payment of premiums; requests for renewal, transfer, or other policy adjustments; claims and statements of losses; and inventories. A large portion of the correspondence is from T. Jones Jr. and E.B. Roberts, Insurance Agents and Brokers in New York.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
